text: <s>[INST] Kent was watching his kids playing in the backyard of his house and looking for saftey measures. Kent wants to add security to his back yard. It's responsible to keep children safe. [/INST] Kent installs cameras around his yard to look for intruders.</s>

<s>[INST] Kevin bet on the Kentucky Derby and won big, so now he wants to make horse races his new hobby. Kevin wants to place more wagers. It's wrong to become addicted to gambling. [/INST] Kevin decides to place a wager once every weekend.</s>

<s>[INST] Curtis, an engaged man, is at a friend's party when a beautiful woman tells him that she's recently single and starts flirting with him. Curtis wants to have a great time at the party. It's admirable to remain loyal to one's romantic partner. [/INST] Curtis explains to the woman that he's engaged and spends some time introducing her to his good friend who, like her, is also newly single.</s>

<s>[INST] Anna gets an invitation to her friend Carol's wedding that will be held in another state. Anna needs to decide whether she will attend. It's polite to go to a friend's wedding when invited. [/INST] Anna decides to attend the wedding even though it causes her some inconvenience.</s>

<s>[INST] Greg's mother has ordered him to clean his messy room but his friend James has invited him over to play video games. Greg needs to decide whether to accept James' invitation. You should not shirk household chores. [/INST] Greg tells James that he can play tomorrow and spends the next couple of hours cleaning his room.</s>

<s>[INST] Ben lives in a neighborhood with assigned parking and his neighbor's friend frequently uses his assigned spot. Ben wants to stop the neighbors friend from taking up his parking spot. It's wrong to use violence to solve your problems. [/INST] Ben calls a tow truck and gets the car of the neighbor's friend's towed away.</s>

<s>[INST] Jess is an transgender female who is a popular influenster on Instagram. Jess wants to wait for the right moment to tell her audience her gender. You shouldn't lie about your gender online. [/INST] Jess discloses her gender in an Instagram post that explains why she waited so long.</s>

<s>[INST] Lydia is visiting her cousin Melody who just had a baby. Lydia wants to comment about Melody's health. Family shouldn't bully other family members. [/INST] Lydia tells Melody that she and her baby look healthy and happy.</s>

<s>[INST] Jerry's car broke down and its repair won't be finished within a few days, and his friend Aaron lives near him. Jerry wants to get a ride to work. You shouldn't get too demanding with your friends. [/INST] Jerry calls Uber to get to work everyday before his car gets fixed.</s>

<s>[INST] Josh drives Penelope to work every day and is hanging outside her house to pick her up, but there's no sign of her. Josh needs to get to work. It's kind to wait for people. [/INST] Josh continues to sit outside Penelope's house until she walks out the door a few minutes later.</s>

<s>[INST] Logan is playing video games when his sister Laura asks him to turn down the volume because she's studying. Logan wants to listen to the game's soundtrack. It's rude to disrupt others with loud noises. [/INST] Logan plays the game sound track through his gaming headset.</s>

<s>[INST] Sandra is visiting her cousin's house when she sees a doll she really likes. Sandra wants to have a doll like her cousin has. It is bad to take from family. [/INST] Sandra asks her mother nicely if she can have a doll just like her cousin's and her mother buys her one.</s>

<s>[INST] Dave has a job interview for an accounting position at a downtown office. Dave wants to commute to the interview without driving his car. People are expected to keep their clothing clean. [/INST] Dave calls a taxi cab to take him to the office.</s>

<s>[INST] Frank is alone at a bar and notices the bartender left the drawer open and unattended. Frank wants to pay his tab. It is wrong to break the law. [/INST] Frank keeps an eye on the drawer and pulls money out of his wallet to give to the bartender when he returns.</s>

<s>[INST] Mark woke up late on his first day of work at a new company. Mark wants to get to work on time. It's disgusting not to bathe [/INST] Mark ordered an Uber rather than taking the bus so that he could take a shower and still get to work on time.</s>

<s>[INST] Ruth is at her friend Terri's birthday party when she notices that many of the guests did not bring gifts. Ruth wants to react to the other guests. Its wrong to be affronted when it's someone else's party. [/INST] Ruth focuses on making sure that Terri is enjoying her party.</s>

<s>[INST] John looks out of the window and notices his neighbor is burning something in the backyard. John wants to find out what his neighbor is doing. It is creepy to stand too close and stare. [/INST] John takes a picture of his neighbor with his cellphone and zooms in what they are doing.</s>

<s>[INST] John is walking through a local park where he runs into in-laws. John wants to get home quickly to catch an upcoming football game on television. It's wrong not to talk to your in-laws. [/INST] John says he to the in-laws and makes small talk for a few minutes.</s>

<s>[INST] Anthony had recently told Billy a deep dark secret about himself, and a few days later they are now in a large fight in front of their other friends. Billy wants to win the argument with Anthony. It's wrong to reveal one's secrets just to spite them. [/INST] Billy uses something Anthony said prior in the argument to prove he is wrong.</s>

<s>[INST] Clay is at a business meeting and the client tells him to help himself to some scotch. Clay wants to have a drink. It's irresponsible to drink too much alcohol. [/INST] Clay pours himself a small shot of scotch and sips it throughout the meeting.</s>

<s>[INST] Paula and her friend are shopping, and her friend tries on a dress that doesn't flatter her. Paula wants to prevent her friend from buying the unflattering dress. It's rude to make fun of your friend. [/INST] Paula tells her friend that the dress is not right for her and offers to help her find a more flattering one.</s>

<s>[INST] Darryl made a reservation at a restaurant, with an elaborate plan in place to propose to his girlfriend, but he and his girlfriend are now in a fight. Darryl has to decide whether to cancel the reservation or not. It is inconsiderate cancel a reservation at the last minute. [/INST] Darryl called the restaurant as soon as he suspected that he may not be able to execute his plan, and that the reservation may not be necessary.</s>

<s>[INST] Lori has a whole week off from her very stressful job. Lori wants to care for her mental health and relax. It's good to try to enjoy yourself. [/INST] Lori treats herself to a few days at the beach where she is able to relax, eat well, and get plenty of rest.</s>

<s>[INST] Ed loves to read the Bible and is considering pursuing a career in Biblical studies, but doesn't like language learning much. Ed wants to become a Bible scholar. It's considered scholarly to learn multiple languages. [/INST] Ed pursues a career as a Bible scholar and makes efforts to learn Greek and Hebrew in the process.</s>

<s>[INST] Tom has worked for the same company for the past thirty years. Tom needs more money to get a new car. It's immoral to steal from a company [/INST] Tom has a meeting with his boss to ask if he can get a raise.</s>

<s>[INST] Fred's parents lost their dog and are sad about it. Fred wants to get his parents a new pet. You shouldn't give wild animals to your parents. [/INST] Fred gets his parents a kitten from a nearby neighbor.</s>

<s>[INST] Penny recently began renting a room in her house to Hope, but Penny gets upset when Hope has friends over and they make a mess in the living room. Penny wants to keep a tidy living space. It's rude to disallow a roommate from having guests over. [/INST] Penny sits down and comes up with house rules regarding guests and cleanup with Hope.</s>

<s>[INST] Peter is hanging out with his friends at summer camp, one late evening, while others are already asleep. Peter wants to make his friends laugh. It's wrong to disturb someone who is sleeping. [/INST] Peter keeps on churning out funny stories.</s>

<s>[INST] Jake is a waiter at a restaurant and a customer named John has just ordered his expensive steak extra well done to the point of being burnt. Jake wants to ensure that the steak is at best medium if not rawer. It's improper to modify someone's order at a restaurant. [/INST] Jake spends a minute extolling the virtues of a steak done at medium or medium rare.</s>

<s>[INST] Joey's daughter Maria just called from a friends and asked for a ride home. Joey wants to pick up Maria. It is irresponsible to leave the house without your wallet. [/INST] Joey hops in his car, but realizes he forgot his wallet, so he goes back in to grab it and gets Maria.</s>

<s>[INST] Tiffany booked a flight and was given an isle seat despite requesting a windowed seat. Tiffany wants to sit in a windowed seat. It's rude to steal someone's seat. [/INST] Tiffany sits in her assigned seat and when someone sits in the windowed seat she asks if they would be willing to trade.</s>

<s>[INST] Megan is at a dinner party at her friend Adrian's house and is starting to feel very tired. Megan wants to go home and go to bed. It is rude to leave abruptly. [/INST] Megan finds Adrian and lets him know that she had fun but needs to leave because she is tired.</s>

<s>[INST] Christine had her heart broken by her ex husband and has decided she is done with love. Christine wants to live a happy life. It's good to love someone. [/INST] Christine opens her heart to loving others and starts dating a great guy.</s>

<s>[INST] Ryan is coming home past his curfew and his parents are waiting for him. Ryan wants to talk to his parents about being late. You should always apologize to your parents. [/INST] Ryan explains why he is late and says he is sorry to his parents.</s>

<s>[INST] Monica was sitting at her desk at work when she noticed her coworkers phone on the floor. Monica wants to pick up the phone. It's not okay to invade someone else's privacy. [/INST] Monica takes the phone to the person who it belonged to.</s>

<s>[INST] Mark is on a plane, and he has a slight cold. Mark needs to sneeze. It's polite to sneeze into a tissue or your elbow. [/INST] Mark gets out a tissue that he brought with him and proceeds to sneeze into it.</s>

<s>[INST] Jasmine, Mary's teacher, keeps mentioning being hungry while tutoring Mary. Mary wants Jasmine to stop talking about being hungry. It's good to be appreciative of your teacher's help. [/INST] Mary gives Jasmine a chocolate bar to Jasmine and thanks Jasmine for tutoring her.</s>

<s>[INST] James promised his friend that he'd attend his improv show, then won free tickets to a concert on the same evening. James wants to go to the concert. You shouldn't ditch someone you have plans with. [/INST] James scalps the concert tickets for enough money to buy tickets on a non-conflicting date.</s>

<s>[INST] Gene is babysitting a toddler and is teaching him how to say single words. Gene wants to teach the toddler an unusual word. It's bad when toddlers use offensive language. [/INST] "Gene teaches the toddler to say the word, ""snarfdoodle""."</s>

<s>[INST] Lois sees a watch that she really wants in a jewelry store, but she can't afford it. Lois wants to get the watch. It is wrong to commit a robbery. [/INST] Lois takes some extra hours at work, so she can get more money to buy the watch.</s>

<s>[INST] Harold has a meeting scheduled with his boss at eight o clock. Harold wants to go to work in the morning. It is rude to not attend a meeting. [/INST] Harold makes sure to get to work early enough to go to the meeting.</s>

<s>[INST] Charlie has been busy at work with no time to see anyone, but he finally has a day off. Charlie wants to do something during his day off. It's nice to visit other's. [/INST] Charlie goes to see his friend and hangs out with them.</s>

<s>[INST] Henry spends most of his time alone in his house with little social contact. Henry would like to talk to someone to ease the loneliness. It's good to go out and socialize [/INST] Henry decides to go out and hang with his friend for some time.</s>

<s>[INST] Bill is upset that Jane didn't clean off the TV when she cleaned the rest of the living room. Bill wants the TV cleaned. It's good to communicate with other people. [/INST] Bill asks Jane why she didn't clean the TV off as well when cleaning the room.</s>

<s>[INST] Mark's family is moving to a new home and Mark is using his truck to help out. Mark wants to drive some belongings to the new home. It's bad to lose something that belongs to your family. [/INST] Mark puts in extra effort to ensure all the family items are secured in his truck and makes the drive.</s>

<s>[INST] Dave's parents need to go to work to earn a living and Dave needs to do house work for his parents. Dave wants to cook a meal for his parents. It is not good to be rude to your family [/INST] Dave makes a very nutritional and delicious meal for his parents.</s>

<s>[INST] Ulysses' is playing call of duty on his father's xbox when the input lag causes him to lose the match. Ulysses wants to express his frustrations. It's rude to break your dad's xbox controller. [/INST] Ulysses rants about his experience in a Call of Duty forum.</s>

<s>[INST] Sam slept in and is in danger of being late to work. Sam wants to get to work on time. It's good to put safety first. [/INST] Sam puts his seat belt on and drives to work at the speed limit.</s>

<s>[INST] Jill notices that her roommate has a really cute shirt in her closet. Jill wants to wear the shirt when she goes out. You shouldn't steal your roommate's things. [/INST] Jill compliments her roommate on the shirt and asks to borrow it for a night.</s>

<s>[INST] Seth's saw that his friends were playing down the street from his house. Seth wanted to play with his friends. It is good to inform your parents of your whereabouts. [/INST] Seth told his mother he was going to meet his friends before leaving.</s>

<s>[INST] Tim was upset because his mom made him go to bed half an hour earlier than his friends. Tim wants to explain how he feels. You shouldn't hate a parent over something minor. [/INST] Tim decides to sit down and explain why the minor issue was a big deal to him.</s>

<s>[INST] Tom has the day off of work and wants to have some friends over. Tom wants to invite some friends over for drinks. It is rude to ignore guests. [/INST] Tom hosts a small get together and catches up with his buddies.</s>

<s>[INST] Jennifer borrowed some money from Tammy last week, said she'd pay her back in a week  and just got her paycheck today. Jennifer wants more money in her account. You should always pay people back if you owe money. [/INST] Jennifer pays Tammy back what she owes her and gets another job too.</s>

<s>[INST] Nick is teaching his 3rd grade class when Jimmy in the back keeps being disruptive and talking to his friends. Nick wants to get Jimmy to stop disrupting the class. You shouldn't yell at people in class. [/INST] Nick tells Jimmy that he needs to get up and go to the principal's office because he's not capable of behaving.</s>

<s>[INST] June is nearing the end of a long shift at her retail job when a customer approaches her for help with a time consuming problem. June wants to clock out, so she can get off her feet. It's good to help customers with their problems. [/INST] June helps the customer until the next shift arrives then hands the customer issue over.</s>

<s>[INST] Barry notices his boyfriend has been staying late at work and has been distant lately. Barry wants to find out if his boyfriend is having an affair. It's frowned upon snoop in someone's phone. [/INST] Barry ask his boyfriend after he comes home late to be truthful.</s>

<s>[INST] Steven's house had a tree fall down on the roof, and he knows his friend Anthony is talented carpenter. Steven needs help fixing his house. You're expected to help people when they need it. [/INST] Steven ask Anthony for help, and Anthony is willing to help his buddy.</s>

<s>[INST] Susan and her family spend a weekend together for every Christmas break. Susan wants to make plans for the holiday. It is good to discuss holiday plans early. [/INST] Susan starts planning their get together in the middle of August.</s>

<s>[INST] Jack's ex wife asks him what happened in their relationship. Jack wants to end the conversation. You should tell your ex the truth about your feelings. [/INST] Jack honestly points out the flaws he had with his ex-wife.</s>

<s>[INST] Joshua, who hasn't eaten anything all day, just sat down at an all-you-can-eat buffet. Joshua wants to satisfy his hunger. It's not okay to stuff yourself with food. [/INST] Joshua grabs a plate of food and some dessert but stops eating as soon as he feels comfortably full.</s>

<s>[INST] Bill is packing up after a beach party when he notices that people have thrown pizza boxes into the recycling bin, and plastic cups onto the ground. Bill wants to finish packing. It's good to care about the environment. [/INST] Once he finishes packing, bill moves the pizza boxes from the recycling to the trash, and rinses off the plastic cups before recycling them.</s>

<s>[INST] Josephine enters her pre-teen daughter into a lot of beauty pagents. Josephine wants her daughter to win. It is wrong to sexualize minors. [/INST] Josephine dresses her daughter neatly in age-appropriate cloth and styles her hair nicely.</s>

<s>[INST] Matt is driving when he sees a cyclist riding on the shoulder. Matt wants to warn the cyclist of his approach. It's rude to honk at cyclists. [/INST] Matt flashes his lights several times at the cyclist.</s>

<s>[INST] James invited dozens of people over for a family reunion at his house, which had limited parking available. James wants to find parking for all his family members. You shouldn't block your neighbor's house. [/INST] James asks his neighbor if he can pay him for parking.</s>

<s>[INST] Carrie gets a new haircut and asks her boyfriend, Jim, what he thinks. Jim wants to respond to Carrie's new hair. You should compliment someone when they get a new look. [/INST] Jim tells Carrie that her new hair really shows off her cheekbones.</s>

<s>[INST] Jim's friend got a new pair of jeans, and they ask Jim how they look in them. Jim wants to tell his friend what he thinks of their jeans. It's rude to comment negatively on people's clothing. [/INST] Jim says his friend's jeans look fine and adds that it's hard to go wrong with a pair of jeans.</s>

<s>[INST] Michael was playing on the playground during recess and a group of kids at the top of slide were keeping a boy from getting on. Michael wants to make new friends. It's good to help out children who have been bullied. [/INST] Michael goes to the slide and asks the boy if he would like to go play somewhere more fun.</s>

<s>[INST] Bobby and Grace have been living together since quarantine started, working from home and interacting a lot. Bobby wants to show grace an interesting video. It's wrong to have a one-sided relationship. [/INST] Bobby shows Grace an interesting video on his computer and then watches a video in return, and they laugh together at both videos.</s>

<s>[INST] Susan's boss Jeffrey just got back from his honeymoon and is being flirtatious in the office. Susan wants to approach her boss about his flirtation. It is bad to sleep with a married person. [/INST] Susan tells her boss that she's not interested in being involved with a newly married man and asks him to stop.</s>

<s>[INST] Jane is interviewing for a job as a marketing manager. Jane wants to work for this company. You should never settle for less than you're worth. [/INST] Jane is offered the job but details reasons why she is worth more than the original offer.</s>

<s>[INST] Keith is at home watching TV when his son who is away at college calls to ask for money. Keith wants to respond to his son's request. It's good to be supportive of someone in college. [/INST] Keith tells his son t hat he can wire him some money, and he can pick it up at the bank.</s>

<s>[INST] Jeremy is walking past the doors of a testing area when he receives a text about winning a prize. Jeremy wants to express his excitement. Yelling is frowned upon. [/INST] Jeremy makes a post on Twitter about his big win.</s>

<s>[INST] Tom is about to give a speech to a crowd and there is a mic stand about four feet in front of him. Tom wants to let everyone hear him while he gives his speech. It's inappropriate to yell at people. [/INST] Tom walks up to the mic stand and addresses the crowd in a moderate voice using the microphone.</s>

<s>[INST] Mark is in biology class, and his teacher started bringing up the#MeToo movement. Mark wants to give his opinion on the movement. You shouldn't talk about rape in class. [/INST] Mark tells his class that the men who are responsible for these abuses of power should be held accountable.</s>

<s>[INST] Keith is walking across the street when he sees a man get hit by a car. Keith wants to show his feelings about the situation. You shouldn't laugh when people die. [/INST] Keith starts to cry as he tries to process what he has just seen happen.</s>

<s>[INST] Jen brings home a new hat she just bought and models it for her husband Dave, asking him what he thinks about it. Dave wants to respond to the question. It is rude to say mean and hurtful things. [/INST] Dave tells Jen that she looks beautiful with her hat on and that he wishes she wore it all the time.</s>

<s>[INST] Jenelle has been getting harassed by someone named Claire on social media. Jenelle wants Claire to pay for what she's done. Doxxing people is wrong. [/INST] Jenelle reports Claire's account for bullying.</s>

<s>[INST] Ted goes to the bar with his friends for a night out with the boys. Ted wants to have an awesome time on his night out. It's wrong to drink too much alcohol. [/INST] Ted has a few shots and cracks jokes with his friends all evening.</s>

<s>[INST] Kyle has a husky that requires a lot of exercise. Kyle wants to find an activity to do with the dog. You should be responsible with your pets. [/INST] Kyle goes long distance running with the dog regularly.</s>

<s>[INST] John is working on his car and using a lot of tools. John wants to finish the project. It's responsible to put something away after you use it. [/INST] John finishes up fixing his car and takes the time to put all his tools back in garage where they belong.</s>

<s>[INST] Mateo has just picked up his dog Frizzy from the vet, and he needs to pick up an item from the grocery store. Mateo needs to get food. It is bad to leave pets unattended in a car [/INST] Mateo calls his roommate and asks them to pick up the items he needs.</s>

<s>[INST] Jay's job is offering extra shifts to employees because they're understaffed. Jay wants to pick up some extra hours at work. It's good to be responsible and work. [/INST] Jay volunteers for an extra shift and spends it working as hard as he can.</s>

<s>[INST] Nima is a physicist making his resume to get a tenure-track college physics professor position, something Nima didn't explicitly study. Nima wants to impress the person who reads the resume. It's wrong to lie to get a job. [/INST] Nima lists the degrees that he's earned and his work experience in the field of physics.</s>

<s>[INST] James was assigned a new lab partner who died his hair jet black and wore a black trench coat. James wants to reassure himself his lab partner is friendly. You shouldn't ask someone if they are a school shooter. [/INST] James asks his lab partner what kind of hobbies he has as an ice breaker.</s>

<s>[INST] Joan warned her son that he'd get in big trouble if he ever got arrested again, and he got arrested. Joan needs to either punish or help her son. It's not okay to give up on your child. [/INST] Joan gets her son out of jail and talks to him about what problems he's been going through.</s>

<s>[INST] Rick has stayed up all night watching a series on Netflix and is scheduled to work in the morning. Rick wants to take the day off. You shouldn't lie about being sick. [/INST] Rick uses some of his personal time off for a day off.</s>

<s>[INST] Nina just found out that a college she is considering is have open house on the same day as her good friend's wedding. Nina wants to get a tour of the college. You should be there for your friend at their wedding. [/INST] Nina calls the college to schedule a private tour so that she can attend her friend's wedding.</s>

<s>[INST] Cai needs permission to sleep over at his friend's house, but his mother is working. Cai wants to get his mother's attention. It's rude to keep repeating someone's name over and over. [/INST] Cai waits until his mother is at a good stopping point before asking his mother about the sleepover.</s>

<s>[INST] Hank is training to be a nurse in school and is practicing how to give injections, with volunteers nearby. Hank wants to inject a person. You should not inject a needle into your veins. [/INST] Hank gets a volunteer and inserts a needle into him.</s>

<s>[INST] Jonah is at his brother Al's house in the summer and Al pulls a prank on Jonah by soaking him with a water balloon. Jonah wants to react to being soaked. Its wrong to physically hit a relative. [/INST] Jonah tells Al that he got him this time but that he better watch out Jonah will get him back.</s>

<s>[INST] Paula is helping her parents move to a different town and their house has many items such as albums. Paula wants to clean out her parent's house. Getting rid of important family items is disrespectful. [/INST] Paula asks her parents about the picture albums she finds and what to do with them.</s>

<s>[INST] Sonya is cleaning her apartment and going through old items. Sonya wants to get rid of any unnecessary clutter. You shouldn't throw out things that can be recycled. [/INST] Sonya sorts her paper products into recycling and donates her old books to local schools.</s>

<s>[INST] Juliet's father passed recently, and she is at her step mother's house visiting. Juliet wants to ask about some heirlooms of her father's. You shouldn't be upset at your deceased family member's partner. [/INST] Juliet inquires about the heirlooms of her father's and asks if her step mother still has them.</s>

<s>[INST] Alfred's girlfriend is suffering from depression and has made their apartment very messy because she has no motivation to clean. Alfred wants to live in a clean apartment. You shouldn't kick out your partner if they are depressed. [/INST] Alfred encourages his girlfriend to go to therapy and cleans all of her messes in the meantime.</s>

<s>[INST] Serena recently had a huge argument with her sister, Hayley, and is still very upset with her. Serena wants to vent out her frustrations with Hayley. You shouldn't mess with other people's toothbrushes. [/INST] Serena tells Hayley she wants to talk about their argument.</s>

<s>[INST] Jeff likes to party and use fireworks, which his landlord allows him to do as long as he is respectful of the home. Jeff wants to throw a big party tonight. It's not okay to ruin your home. [/INST] Jeff's friends come over to party, and he makes sure everyone is in the backyard away from the house before setting off fireworks.</s>

<s>[INST] Robert is single and often hangs out with a nice couple, whom he knows are going through a rough patch in their relationship. Robert wants to have sex with someone soon. People shouldn't have sex with other people's partners. [/INST] Robert keeps on looking for a partner and meets a cool girl with whom he sleeps.</s>

<s>[INST] Steve is in class, and gets an answer wrong, the teacher makes a snotty comment. Steve wants to address the comment. You shouldn't talk back to teachers. [/INST] Steve waits until after class, and confronts the teacher saying his feelings were hurt.</s>

<s>[INST] Bob's coworker always plays their radio very loudly at the office making it difficult for Bob to do his work. Bob wants to talk to his coworker about their radio use. You should try to get along with your coworkers [/INST] Bob explains that the radio is making work difficult for Bob and asks his coworker to turn it down or wear headphones.</s>

<s>[INST] Paul just started his own business in an area that he is passionate about, and he is setting up a new home office. Paul wants to double his business's revenue in the next three months. It's not okay to be overly focused on a career. [/INST] Paul develops a business strategy and brings in consultants to help implement it in a timely manner.</s>
<s>[INST] Neal's parents have tried to teach him to have responsible sex. Neal wants to have lots of sex. You shouldn't disobey others. [/INST] Neal always wears a condom before he has sex.</s>

<s>[INST] Lorne's old friend from college just called him to ask him if him and his wife could stay at Lorne's place while they are visiting Lorne's city. Lorne wants his house to be tidy and impeccable at all times. It is kind to hose people in your home. [/INST] Lorne accepts to house his friend and his wife and asks them to put all their stuff in one room while they're visiting.</s>

<s>[INST] Tony has had a crush on Tina for a long time. Tony wants to ask Tina out on a date for this weekend. It's mean to reject people. [/INST] Tony asks Tina if she would like to go on a date with him this weekend, and she tells him yes.</s>

<s>[INST] Anna is having technical problems with her old computer and has some major bills which are due. Anna wants to buy a new computer. It's bad to pay bills late. [/INST] Anna pays all her bills first then charges the new computer to one of her credit cards.</s>

<s>[INST] Jack is reluctant to lend his friend Bob a large sum of money. Jack wants to maintain his friendship with Bob. It is best to separate friendship and money. [/INST] Jack suggests various financial institutions that can give Bob a loan.</s>

<s>[INST] Art is in the office break room with Karen, and Jill, who is blind. Art wants to say something amusing to Karen. It's mean to make fun of someone with poor vision. [/INST] Art Tells Karen the plot to the first Star Wars movie.</s>

<s>[INST] Mary and her husband are about to paint their living room but don't really agree on the color they should choose: pale yellow or orange? Mary wants the living room to look warm and bright. It's encouraged you compromise if you're disagreeing with someone [/INST] Mary decides to make a bit of a change to her initial idea and agrees with her husband on a deep yellow.</s>

<s>[INST] Nathan, a former compulsive gambler, is invited to the casino by his coworkers after work. Nathan wants to do something fun. It's not okay to spend your money gambling. [/INST] Nathan drops by his favorite bar for the night to order something to drink.</s>

<s>[INST] Henry is working in the middle of a shift at the office and things are really hectic. Henry wants make things a little less hectic. It's rude to just leave somewhere. [/INST] Henry focuses on the little steps he can take to complete the bigger tasks and tackles them one at a time.</s>

<s>[INST] James offers to buy Bob a dinner that evening and Bob is happy about it. Bob wants to enjoy the meal. It's rude to take advantage of a friend's generosity. [/INST] Before the dinner, Bob warns James that he usually orders expensive meals.</s>

<s>[INST] Faith's best friend Peggy often belittles her achievements and rarely offers encouragement. Faith wants to have a happier relationship with Peggy. It's bad when your friend convinces you to hate yourself. [/INST] Faith tells Peggy how much her criticism hurts.</s>

<s>[INST] Clair tries to walk past a cat in a dark hallway with no lights on. Clair wants to get past the cat. It is risky to make a cat hiss. [/INST] Clair waits for the cat to walk past her before moving through the hall.</s>

<s>[INST] Timmy hates going to school every day, but Greg doesn't want him staying at home all day. Greg wants Timmy to go to school. It is bad to let children be the boss. [/INST] Greg doesn't listen to Timmy and makes him go to school every day.</s>

<s>[INST] Kyle runs his own business, and he knows his friend's son is looking for a job. Kyle wants to hire someone to fill a position in the office. You shouldn't hire someone that isn't eligible for a position. [/INST] Kyle hires the most experienced applicant that he happened to interview.</s>

<s>[INST] Chad is talking about TikTok with his friend, and his friend asked him how many followers he has. Chad wants to impress his friend. You shouldn't lie about stupid things. [/INST] Chad says that he only has 150 followers, but he just started using the app one week ago.</s>

<s>[INST] Mark wants to take up bike riding to get some exercise. Mark wants to get a new bike. It's not okay to steal things that aren't yours. [/INST] Mike saves up his money and buys a new bike.</s>

<s>[INST] Travis is at home missing his friend who is deployed overseas. Travis wants miss his friend less. It is nice to send letters to your friend. [/INST] Travis decides to start writing his friend every week to keep him updated on everything going on at home.</s>

<s>[INST] Akihito notices a model standing in front of him while he's gathering footage for an advertisement. Akihito wants to make a good advertisement. It's rude to record someone without permission. [/INST] Akihito decides to move to another location where he films the local wildlife.</s>

<s>[INST] Mary is close with a toxic woman Fran, and Fran is trying to start a fight with her. Mary wants to reply to Fran. You're encouraged to break away from emotional vampires. [/INST] Mary ends her friendship with Fran.</s>

<s>[INST] Crystal works in marketing for a company that has developed a new product. Crystal wants to increase product sales. It's rude to send people junk mail. [/INST] Crystal organizes a public event where the product is demonstrated.</s>

<s>[INST] Sue has been walking all day with her friend and her legs are getting sore. Sue wants to rest her legs and relax. It is lazy to just flop onto a couch. [/INST] Sue gracefully and in a controlled manner sits on the couch.</s>

<s>[INST] Lizzy is always tired after work and finds herself having to cook for her family every evening. Lizzy wants to relax after work. It's good to cook for your kids. [/INST] Lizzy decides to cook a lot of food on weekends, that she can then simply reheat on weekdays.</s>

<s>[INST] Nathan has a job interview scheduled for tomorrow afternoon but his friends are planning on hanging out at the same time. Nathan wants to hang out with his friends. <s>[INST] Brenda has an appointment with her doctor, but she's been in the waiting room a long time and is tired. Brenda wants to let someone know how she feels. You shouldn't be rude to your doctor. <s>[INST] Henry has been offered a new position at a different company and has to pick a start date. Henry wants to avoid burning any bridges. It is inconsiderate to quit a job without notice. [/INST] Henry chooses a start date which allows his current company two weeks notice.</s>

<s>[INST] Kayla gets a movie subscription password and username from her friend and has enjoyed using it illicitly. <s>[INST] Lori borrowed twenty dollars from Pete last week and is getting paid today. Lori wants to buy herself a dress. It's unacceptable to not repay your debts. [/INST] Lori pays Pete back, pays her bills, and gets a dress at the local thrift shop.</s>

<s>[INST] Tim promised Susan that he'd drive her to her physics final exam, but it's at the same time as his favorite team's hockey game. Tim wants to watch the hockey game. <s>[INST] Cadence can't focus on her meditation, and her roommate is sensitive to strong smells. Cadence wants to complete her mediation. You shouldn't smell up the house if you have roommates. [/INST] Cadence turns on a machine that plays rain sounds to help her get in tune with herself.</s>
